alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 23 at 3:22PM HST until January 24 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Surf along exposed north and west facing shores will ease to around the advisory levels this evening as the current west- northwest swell lowers. A new west-northwest swell building tonight will keep surf near the advisory level on Monday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 12 to 18 feet along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and Maui. Surf of 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai. Surf of 7 to 10 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai, north facing shores of Maui, and west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
